entry.name: smileDetectMode

enum.value: OFF Do not include smile detection statistics in capture results
ON Return smile status and score values

entry.details: When ON, com.intel.cv.smileDetectStatus (dynamic) and com.intel.cv.smileDetectScores (dynamic) outputs are valid.

entry.name: blinkDetectMode

enum.value: OFF Do not include blink detection statistics in capture results
ON Return blink status and score values

entry.details: When ON, com.intel.cv.blinkDetectStatus (dynamic) and com.intel.cv.blinkDetectScores (dynamic) outputs are valid.

entry.name: faceRecognizeMode

enum.value: OFF Do not include face recognition statistics in capture results
ON Return person id and person similarity

entry.details: When ON, com.intel.cv.faceRecognizePersonIds (dynamic) and com.intel.cv.faceRecognizePersonSimilarities (dynamic) outputs are valid.

entry.name: smileDetectStatus
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide a list of smile status of faces. The order of this list is always aligned with the IDs produced by the android-defined metadata tagin. android.statistics.faceIds.
entry.details: True means smiling face. False means non-smiling face

entry.name: smileDetectScores
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide an list of smile confidence scores. The scores are confidence level that the face is smiling.
entry.details: A person's smile intensity is able to be detected. Along with detecting features of a face, the changes and movements of the face are also analyzed in order to index smile intensity.

entry.name: blinkDetectStatus
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide a list of blink status of faces. The order of this list is always aligned with the IDs produced by the android-defined metadata tagin. android.statistics.faceIds.
entry.details: True means closed eye. False means open eye. The meaning of array should be like: "0th face lefe eye|0th face right eye|1th face left eye|1th face right eye|2th face left eye|2th face right eye"

entry.name: blinkDetectScores
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide an list of blink confidence scores. The scores are confidence level that the face is blinking.
entry.details: A person's blink intensity is able to be detected. Along with detecting features of eyes, the changes and movements of eyes are also analyzed in order to index blink intensity.

entry.name: faceRecognizePersonIds
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide a list of person Ids from face recognition. Each person is identified as unique positive integer. This is different from android.statistics.faceIds, which is unique among the tracking session
entry.details: -10000 means unkown face. Positive integer means each person id. 0 is illegal.

entry.name: faceRecognizePersonSimilarities
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide a list of person similarities from face recognition. It is the biggest one of the estimated levels between the input face and the faces in databases. It is good to be tread as a kind of score.
entry.details: 0 is not likely the person 100 is quite sure of the person

entry.name: faceDetectRipAngles
entry.type_notes: (-180~180) x n, where n is number of faces
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide an list of RIP (Rotation In-Plane) angles from face detection. Represented in degree. Also known as 'rolling'.
entry.details: The angle is represented as degree. The upright face is 0 degree, clock wise is positive, CC wise is negatives.

entry.name: faceDetectRopAngles
entry.type_notes: (-1, 0, 1) x n, where n is number of faces
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide an list of ROP (Rotation out-of-plane) angles from face detection. Represented in degree. Also known as 'yawing'. Piching is not supported
entry.details: The frontal face is 0, left profile face is -1, right profile face is 1.

entry.name: availableFaceRecognize
entry.details:
NO is always supported.
Yes means the device supports com.intel.cv.faceRecognizePersonIds and com.intel.cv.faceRecognizePersonSimilarities outputs.

entry.name: availableObjectTrack
entry.details:
NO is always supported.
Yes means the device supports com.intel.cv.objectTrackingBoundingRectangles, com.intel.cv.objectTrackingTrackingIds and com.intel.cv.objectTrackingScores outputs.
